title: Attention Is All You Need Explained
description: A technical breakdown of the Transformer architecture by Richard Walker. Explains self-attention, Q/K/V matrices, and why this design solves the vanishing gradient and parallelization issues found in RNNs.

title: BERT: Pre-training of Deep Bidirectional Transformers for Language Understanding
description: The foundational paper introducing BERT. It uses bidirectional training for Transformers to achieve state-of-the-art results on NLP tasks via Masked Language Modeling (MLM) and Next Sentence Prediction (NSP).

title: Fundamentals of Deep Reinforcement Learning for Learning Continually
description: Professor Marlos Machado revisits Deep RL fundamentals, focusing on the challenges of continual learning, credit assignment, and how neural networks lose plasticity over time.

title: Deep Residual Learning for Image Recognition (ResNet)
description: Introduces Residual Networks (ResNet), which use skip connections to allow the training of extremely deep neural networks (152+ layers) while avoiding the vanishing gradient problem.

title: Inside GPT – Large Language Models Demystified
description: Alan Smith explains the math behind GPT, covering tokenization, high-dimensional embeddings, and how parameters like temperature and Top-P influence the randomness of text generation.

title: WaveNet: A Generative Model for Raw Audio
description: Introduces a deep generative model that operates directly on raw audio waveforms using dilated causal convolutions to produce highly natural-sounding speech and music.

title: Reinforcement Learning Series: Overview of Methods
description: Steve Brunton provides a clear map of the RL landscape, categorizing methods into model-based vs. model-free, and explaining the roles of policy and value functions.

title: A Brief Introduction to Proximal Policy Optimization (PPO)
description: A GeeksforGeeks guide to PPO, explaining the Clipped Surrogate Objective that makes PPO more stable and easier to tune than predecessor algorithms like TRPO.

title: Reinforcement Learning: An Introduction (2nd Edition)
description: The definitive textbook on RL by Richard Sutton and Andrew Barto. Covers MDPs, Dynamic Programming, Temporal-Difference Learning, and Eligibility Traces.

title: Reinforcement Learning: An Introduction (2nd Edition)
description: The definitive textbook on RL by Richard Sutton and Andrew Barto. Covers MDPs, Dynamic Programming, Temporal-Difference Learning, and Eligibility Traces.

title: Reinforcement Learning – Full Course / Introduction
description: A comprehensive YouTube lecture introducing Reinforcement Learning concepts such as MDPs, policies, value functions, and learning algorithms.

title: Bellman Equations, Dynamic Programming, Generalized Policy Iteration | Reinforcement Learning Part 2
description: Lecture on Bellman equations, dynamic programming methods, policy evaluation and improvement, and generalized policy iteration in reinforcement learning.
